protocol_name: Cell Viability Assay on Saponin-treated A431 Cells
protocol_name_html: Cell Viability Assay on Saponin-treated A431 Cells
description: This protocol describes a cell viability assay that uses near-infrared fluorescent detection. Sapphire700 Stain is used to determine cell viability by assessing cell membrane integrity, and the assay is imaged with the Odyssey CLx Imaging System.

materials.reagent_name: 96-well plate, flat bottom, tissue culture treated, black wall with clear bottom

  2. Gescher A. (2000) Staurosporine analogues – pharmacological toys or useful antitumor agents? Crit Rev Oncol Hematol. 34: 127-35

compare_forks.protocol_name_html: Cell Viability Assay with Staurosporine-treated Jurkat Cells

collections.protocol_name: Cell Viability Assay with Sapphire700™ Stain and the Odyssey® CLx and Sa Imaging Systems
collections.protocol_name_html: Cell Viability Assay with Sapphire700™ Stain and the Odyssey® CLx and Sa Imaging Systems

guidelines:
Introduction

 

Cell viability can be assessed based on various cellular features and mechanisms. These include cell membrane integrity (detected by cell impermeable dyes or leakage of intracellular lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) activity), monitoring of ATP with bioluminescence assays, determining esterase activity with Calcein-AM or Fluorescein-DA, measuring cellular Redox status with MTT, MTS, WST, or XTT, and detecting the mitochondrial membrane potential with JC-1. Various cell viability assays have been developed for plate readers (monitoring absorbance and luminescence), flow cytometry, and image cytometry (e.g. NucleoCounter® NC-3000TM from ChemoMetec); however, none of these assays have been optimized for near-infrared detection with the Odyssey Imaging System.

 

This protocol describes a cell viability assay that uses near-infrared fluorescent detection. Sapphire700 Stain is used to determine cell viability by assessing cell membrane integrity, and the assay is imaged with the Odyssey CLx Imaging System.

  • Sapphire700 Stain is cell impermeable and non-fluorescent in healthy, intact cells.

  • When the cell membrane is damaged, the stain binds to intracellular proteins and becomes fluorescent.

  • Fluorescence intensity in the 700 nm channel is correlated to the number of cells with compromised membranes.

  • Convenient, ‘mix-and-read’ homogenous assay requires no washing or reagent transfer steps (shown in Figure 1).

 
This assay measures the total fluorescence in each microplate well, but does not image or count individual cells.
 
For this technical note, A431, Jurkat, and RAW264.7 cells were evaluated. Other cell lines may require optimization. Cell death was induced by applying different concentrations of Staurosporine (STS), Camptothecin (CPT) or Saponin.
  • Saponins are natural surfactants or detergents, found in many plants, that are used to permeabilize or lyse cells.
  • CPT, a cytotoxic quinolone alkaloid extracted from Camptotheca acuminate, is a potent inhibitor of topoisomerase I, an enzyme required for DNA synthesis. CPT induces apoptosis in a dose-dependent manner in vitro and is routinely used as a general method for inducing apoptosis1,2.
  • STS is an alkaloid originally isolated from bacterium Streptomyces staurosporeus. STS is an inhibitor of phospholipid/Ca2+ dependent protein kinase (Protein Kinase C; PKC), and prevents binding of ATP to the kinase. There are multiple ways in which STS induces apoptosis. One way is by activating caspase-3. STS is used to induce apoptosis in many mammalian cell types3.

 

Materials

 

LI-COR Reagents

  • Sapphire700 Stain (LI-COR, P/N 928-40022)

 

Additional Materials

 

  • Tissue culture dishes, 100 x 20 mm style (BD Falcon P/N 353003)

  • 96-well plate, flat bottom, tissue culture treated, black wall with clear bottom (Costar, P/N 3904)

  • RAW264.7 cells (ATCC® TIB-71TM)

  • A431 cells (ATCC® CRL-1555TM)

  • Jurkat cells, Clone E6-1 (ATCC® TIB-152TM)

  • Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS) (ATCC, P/N 30-2020)

  • Dulbecco’s Modified Eagle’s Medium (DMEM) (Sigma, P/N D5796)

  • RPMI-1640 (Sigma, P/N R5886)

  • 0.05% Trypsin-EDTA (1X) (GIBCO, P/N 25300-054)

  • Saponin (Sigma, P/N S4521)

  • Staurosporine (Sigma, P/N S5921)

  • Camptothecin (Sigma, P/N C9911)

 

 

 

Result

 

 

A431 cells (~ 40,000 cells/well) were grown in a 96-well plate. Cells were treated with Saponin at concentrations ranging from 5 to 160 μg/mL for 1 hour and cell viability was assessed with Sapphire700 Stain (1:100). The plate was scanned with an Odyssey CLx Imager (resolution: 169 μm; quality: medium; focus offset: 4.0 mm; intensity: 5). The Trim Signals of the 700 nm channel were used to generate the graph.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data:
{"blocks":[{"key":"fbt3h","text":"    Grow A431 cells in a 100-mm tissue culture dish with growth medium (DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS) using standard cell culture practices. Always make sure that cells are healthy before using them for the experiment.
 
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sg3o","text":"   Grow cells overnight in a humidified CO2 cell culture incubator at 37 °C.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":42,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7vq2i","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"djapj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7814","duration":"64800","label":"","guid":"8C91ACF10E04464EA4DB70D91C471057"}},{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"1449","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"incubation temperature","guid":"4028C006350149FB99E3658F50A261E7"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed28d","text":"   The next day, replace the medium with 50 μL of DMEM containing saponin (5 to 160 μg/mL) without FBS.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"69lp1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7026","amount":"50","unit":"1","label":"DMEM containing saponin w/o FBS","guid":"C2201F31E5CF427B9EE16A1C45B8BFC7"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25elr","text":"   Incubate cells for 60 minutes in a humidified CO2 cell culture incubator at 37 °C. Leave cells untreated as the negative control.
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":51,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9kt0b","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bpme7","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7815","duration":"3600","label":"","guid":"59635B6F57DB445DA7302CE7101632FB"}},{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"1450","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"incubation","guid":"D287A234E0BC4E7E9688ABCF921ADA79"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kkkn","text":"    Add 50 μL of Sapphire700 Stain (1:50 dilution in DMEM) to each well.
 
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a948t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7027","amount":"50","unit":"1","label":"Sapphire700 Stain","guid":"23F63FB4670C425DBB02E574ECA28842"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nvt7","text":"    Incubate cells in a humidified CO2 cell culture incubator at 37 °C for 30 minutes.
 
 
 
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":37,"length":1,"style":"sub"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c0aeu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"c7rv6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"7816","duration":"1800","label":"","guid":"72516AD1B6444F0182D240CEFB3AC5EB"}},{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"1451","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"incubation","guid":"C35BA395707646B5ABF8F3A3743B62CC"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9havt","text":"    Scan the plate with detection in the 700 nm channel, using an Odyssey CLx Imager.
